content.statement: aaa-012-inflammatory-aaa is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aaa that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding aaa-012-inflammatory-aaa helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of aaa-012-inflammatory-aaa include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of aaa-012-inflammatory-aaa.

complications.duodenal_involvement: Adherence to third portion of duodenum
complications.ivc_involvement: May encase or compress inferior vena cava

definitions_glossary.inflammatory_AAA: AAA variant with wall thickening, fibrosis, and adhesion to adjacent structures
definitions_glossary.perianeurysmal_fibrosis: Dense fibrous tissue surrounding the aneurysm wall
definitions_glossary.IgG4_related_disease: Systemic fibroinflammatory condition that can manifest as IAAA
definitions_glossary.rim_sign: CT finding of enhancing thickened aortic wall in IAAA

mri_features: T2 hyperintense periaortic tissue in active inflammation

surgical_considerations.approach: Retroperitoneal approach may be preferred to avoid duodenal injury
surgical_considerations.evar_considerations: Feasible if anatomy permits; may reduce surgical morbidity

definition.@value: AAA variant with wall thickening, perianeurysmal fibrosis, and adhesion to adjacent structures

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Recognize clinical and imaging features of IAAA
Understand surgical implications of perianeurysmal inflammation
Differentiate IAAA from mycotic and standard AAA
clinical_pearls: Always check for hydronephrosis on preoperative imaging
Consider IgG4-related disease workup if systemic features present
Fibrosis typically regresses after successful AAA repair
EVAR avoids the hostile retroperitoneum when anatomy permits
